monster.name: Animated Statue
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the animated statue remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

trait.name: Spell Immunity
trait.text: The animated statue is immmune to two spells chosen by its creator.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The animated statue makes two slam attacks or one choke attack.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Choke
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the animated statue can't grapple another target. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 9 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Behemoth

trait.name: Fearsome Presence
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 120 ft. of the behemoth must make on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the behemoth for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the feature for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The behemoth does double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the behemoth has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The behemoth makes three attacks: two bite attacks and one gore attack with its horns.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 49 (6d12 + 10) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 54 (8d10 + 10) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 43 (6d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Earthshake (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The behemoth slams the ground and a thunderous burst goes outwards 120 ft. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, taking 105 (30d6) thunder damage on a failed save and it is knocked prone, or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: The behemoth makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Gore
legendary.text: The behemoth makes a gore attack.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 43 (6d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 10 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Boatman

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the boatman is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the boatman instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The boatman's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 with spell attacks). The boatman can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, prestidigitation • 3/Day: burning hands, detect thoughts • 1/Day: scroching ray, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The boatman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The boatman makes two attacks with its oar spear.

action.name: Oar Spear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning or piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dark Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the affected creature takes a long rest.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The boatman adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, the boatman must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, prestidigitation, burning hands, detect thoughts, scroching ray, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 11 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Careless Whisper
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The careless whisper can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the careless whisper can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the careless whisper has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Shake Confidence
action.text: The careless whisper targets one creature it can see within 5 ft. If the target can hear the careless whisper, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be at disadvantage for all Initiative rolls for 24 hours.

action.name: Uninspire
action.text: The careless whisper targets one creature it can see within 5 ft. If the target can hear the careless whisper, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be at disadvantage for all saving throws for 1 minute.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 12 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Cave Hydra

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The cave hydra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the cave hydra has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Tentacle Charge
trait.text: If the cave hydra moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target using its tentacles and then hits with one of its tentacles on the same turn, that one target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must also succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throwor be knocked prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cave hydra makes five attacks with its tentacles or one bite attack.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the cave hydra can't use the same tentacle on another target. The cave hydra has five tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The cave hydra makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the hydra, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the cave hydra's turns. A cave hydra can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the cave hydra dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.description:
Lurking in subterranean pools, rivers, and lakes is this deadly monstrosity. In the dark, murky underground water its not easy to see what lives below. Legendary tales warn adventurers to stay away from these underground bodies of water where the cave hydra might dwell.
Lone Lurker. It lives a solitary existence, waiting patiently for prey to wander by. This predator can survive a long time without feeding, but when prey arrives it boldly attacks. Despite their size, these monsters can move quickly on land or in the water.
Armed to the Teeth. The cave hydra uses its many tentacles to attack multiple targets. If possible, it will pull victims into its massive jaws and swallow them.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 13 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Chasm Fiend
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The chasm fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Running Leap
trait.text: The chasm fiend's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 20 ft. when it has a running start.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The chasm fiend can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The chasm fiend has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the chasm fiend has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chasm fiend makes two attacks with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 14 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dark Maiden

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The dark maiden's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The dark maiden can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 2/Day: charm person, detect magic, detect thoughts • 1/Day: dispel evil and good, entangle, enthrall, feather fall, hold person, hypnotic pattern, silence, sleep

trait.name: Inscrutable
trait.text: The dark maiden is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the storyweaver's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dark maiden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dark maiden makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the dark maiden can grapple the target (escape DC 16). It can only grapple one target at a time.

action.name: Confusing Gaze
action.text: When a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the dark maiden and can see its eyes, the dark maiden can magically force it to make a DC 16 Charisma saving throw, unless the dark maiden is incapacitated. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during that turn. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

action.name: Dark Kiss
action.text: The dark maiden kisses a creature it has grappled,a charmed creature, or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throws against this magic, taking 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target takes finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, minor illusion, prestidigitation, charm person, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel evil and good, entangle, enthrall, feather fall, hold person, hypnotic pattern, silence, sleep
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 15 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dark Trader

trait.name: Dark Bargain
trait.text: The dark trader has advantage on Charisma checks when buying and selling goods.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The dark trader's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The dark trader can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, prestidigitation, vicious mockery • 3/Day: detect thoughts, pass without trace, tongues • 1/Day: calm emotions, hypnotic pattern

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the dark trader can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, prestidigitation, vicious mockery, detect thoughts, pass without trace, tongues, calm emotions, hypnotic pattern

monster.name: Deep Guide

trait.name: Dungeoneer's Gear
trait.text: This fey is equipped with a Dungeoneer's Pack.

trait.name: Faultless Guide
trait.text: If the deep guide is given a location in the Underworld, it knows the direction and distance to the location.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The deep guide's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The deep guide can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, light, pass without trace • 1/Day: dispel evil and good, entangle, silence

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The deep guide has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The deep guide has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deep guide makes two attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Vanish (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When the deep guide takes damage, it can turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet away to an unoccupied space it can see. It remaines invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks or casts a spell.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, light, pass without trace, dispel evil and good, entangle, silence

monster.name: Demon Frog
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The demon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the demon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The demon's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft. without a running start.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Stinking Croak (3/Day)
action.text: The demon croaks and exhales a cloud of disgusting green gas within a 20-foot radius. The gas spreads around corners and the area is lightly obscured. It lasts fro 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned this way, the target can either take an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 18 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Demon Snail
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the demon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Toxic Trail
trait.text: The demon leaves a 5-ft wide toxic trail of slime behind it for 30 ft. Any creature that touches the slime takes 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Slime Spit
action.text: The demon spits toxic orange slime in a 15-foot cone. Any creature in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monster.name: Demon Spider
monster.resist: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the demon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. Each turn the target remains in the web, they take 7 (2d6) fire damage. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12, hp 15; immunity to fire, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 20 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Diamond Dog

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the diamond dog moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a headbutt attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The diamond dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the diamond dog has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
trait.text: The diamond dog can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Headbutt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Crystal Dragon
monster.resist: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The dragon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the crystal dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the Dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become Frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the Effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Crystal Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Dragon exhales crystals in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful DC 19 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed by the crystals. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Psychic Shout
legendary.text: The dragon shouts and each creature within 60 feet must make a successful DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the storm dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The sea dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 22 (Homebrew)

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite

action.name: Frightful Presence

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the Effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Lava Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Dragon exhales lava in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If the target loses half of their hit points from this attack, the lava solidifies and the target is restrained. The target can make a DC 15 Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns to break free from the solid lava.

legendary.name: Detect

legendary.name: Tail Attack

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)

monster.name: Duergar, Assassin
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Assassinate
trait.text: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Once per turn, the assassin deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the assassin has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically reduces in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While reduced, the duergar is Tiny, and reduces its weapon damage to 1. It gains a +5 bonus to all Dexterity (Stealth) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. It can also Hide as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Duerdagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. Can cast darkness once a day.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, or 1 piercing damage and 3 (1d6) poison damage when reduced. Can cast darkness once a day.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster.spells: enlarge/reduce
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 28 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Duergar, King

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text:
The duergar king's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit). The duergar king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: blade ward, true strike • 3/Day: hunter's mark, jump

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes three attacks.

action.name: King's Knife
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Call to Attack
action.text: The duergar king can use its action to call up to 3 allied duergar within 120 ft. that can hear it to each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster.spells: blade ward, true strike, hunter's mark, jump, enlarge/reduce
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 29 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dwarvon Golem
monster.immune: fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the dwarvon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal golden statue.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the dwarvon is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The dwarvon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dwarvon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dwarvon makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Giant Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dwarvon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 31 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dwarf, Bear Rider
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Born to the Saddle
trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount. If it does fall off its mount and descends no more than 10 feet, it can land on its feet if it's not incapacitated. Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs it only 5 feet of movement, rather than half its speed.

trait.name: Cavalry Training
trait.text: When the dwarf hits a target with a melee attack while mounted on a bear, the bear can make a melee attack against the same target as a reaction.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bear rider makes two attacks with its longsword or one attack with its crossbow.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 32 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dwarf, Commander
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bear rider makes two attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the dwarf can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the dwarf. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the dwarf is incapacitated.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 33 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dwarf, Crasher
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the crasher hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The crasher makes two unarmed attacks or one battering ram or crossbow attack.

action.name: Unarmed
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battering Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and target is pushed 10 ft.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Block the Path
action.text: Until the start of the dwarf's next turn, attack rolls against the dwarf have disadvantage, it has advantage on opportunity attack rolls, and its opportunity attacks deal an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. Also, each enemy that tries to move out of the dwarf's reach without teleporting must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of the dwarf's next turn.

monster.description:
Wood splinters in all directions as the doors of a drow wilderness manor are destroyed. Rushing forward are muscled dwarves with battering rams. Dwarf crashers are at the front of many assaults by the dwarf army. Many other dwarves don't get along with these aggressive soldiers.
Explosive Entrance. Crashers are armed with battering rams and spears. The battering rams are used to smash into buildings or drive headlong into masses of enemy troops. Spears are strapped on the backs of these warriors.
Bearded Blockade. Not only can the crashers smash their way forward, they are also able to block opponents from moving. Getting past these dwarves is a very difficult task.
Dour Demeanor. These warriors are known to be very sober and have little sense of humor. Years of punishment has also left scars and many injuries on their stocky frames. Some compare the demeanor of dwarf crashers to their duergar cousins.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 34 (Homebrew)

trait.text: The dwarf has advantage on attack rolls against spiders and driders. In addition, the dwarf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to track spiders and driders.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the dwarf knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The drow is a 5th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit). It has the following spells prepared.
• Cantrips (at will): message, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost • 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, witch bolt • 2nd level (3 slots): arcane lock, misty step, web • 3rd level (3 slots): slow

action.text: For 1 minute, the drow can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the drow. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the drow is incapacitated.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, levitate, message, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost, charm person, detect magic, magic missile, witch bolt, arcane lock, misty step, web, slow
monster.description:
Being the most arrogant of an arrogant race says a lot. Drow nobles really do think they're the greatest thing under the sun. Very far under the sun.
Elf Leadership. These nobles join with the priestesses to make up the leadership of the drow. Most are female and part of the matriarchy that rules all the dark elves. They reside in elegant stone manors hollowed out from huge stalagmites or stalactites. Many drow are under their command and they have considerable influence.
House Elves. Drow nobles are the heads of noble houses made up of the most powerful families. They rule with a cruel hand and scheme to bring other houses into ruin.
Hellish Horses. Many of these nobles use nightmares as their mounts.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 43 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The drow can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The drow is a 9th level wizard. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit). It has the following spells prepared.
• Cantrips (at will): blade ward, fireboltmessage, minor illusion • 1st level (4 slots): feather fall, mage armor, magic missile, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, misty step, scorching ray • 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, water breathing • 4th level (3 slots): arcane eye, blight, wall of fire • 5th level (1 slots): scrying

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The drow can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Dagger +2
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, or fall unconscious for 1 minute from the effects of a sleeping toxin. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

trait.name: Born to the Saddle
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount. If it does fall off its mount and descends no more than 10 feet, it can land on its feet if it's not incapacitated. Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs it only 5 feet of movement, rather than half its speed.

trait.name: Cavalry Training
trait.text: When the drow hits a target with a melee attack while mounted on a giant spider, the spider can make a melee attack against the same target as a reaction.

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: The drow can use a bonus action on its turn to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The drow can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

trait.name: Inscrutable
trait.text: The drow is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the drow's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Second-Story Work
trait.text: Climbing does not cost the drow extra movement. In addition, when the drow makes a running jump, the distance it covers increases by 3 feet.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Once per turn, the drow deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that isn't incapacitated and the drow doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Toxic Tooth
trait.text: One of the drow's teeth is a false tooth filled with a deadly, poisonous fungus. If it is broken open, it kills the drow in seconds.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes two attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monster.name: Vampire Drow
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The vampire's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The vampire can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only), silence

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 20 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from Holy Water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: While not in sunlight or running water, the vampire can use its action to polymorph into a giant bat or giant spider.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the drow disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Weaknesses
trait.text: Forbiddance, Running Water, Stake to the Heart.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
action.text: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite Attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 16).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is Grappled by the vampire, Incapacitated, or Restrained. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 6 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a Long Rest. The target dies if this Effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a Vampire Spawn under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
action.text: The vampire Targets one Humanoid it can see within 30 ft. of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be Charmed by the vampire. The Charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or Actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bit Attack. Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, Ending the Effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the Effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a Bonus Action to end the Effect.

action.name: Denizens of the Underworld (1/Day)
action.text: The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of insects (spiders). The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, Acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The swarms remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a Bonus Action.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
legendary.text: The vampire makes one unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, levitate, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 106 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Fungah, Spore Dragon
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the spore dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the Dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become Frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the Effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Spore Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Dragon exhales dark spores in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constituion saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the storm dragon must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The sea dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to wake it up.

• At will: minor illusion, pass without trace • 3/Day: calm emotions, entangle, silence • 1/Day: compulsion, confusion, counterspell, dispel magic, hallucinatory terrain

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The fungah has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.text: While in sunlight, the fungah disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) poison damage and become poisoned. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's hit points are reduced to 0, they are fully infected by the dark spores and rise as an infected creature. Their alignment changes to neutral evil, they only speak Primordial, they have magic resistance, and they follow the directions of the Undervoid.

monster.name: Fungah, Madcap

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the madcap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a Medium-sized mushroom.

trait.name: Foment Madness
trait.text: Any creature that isn't a madcap that starts its turn within 10 feet of a madcap must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, or it hears muttering voices in its head for a moment and has disadvantage on on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. If the creature fails its saving throw by 7 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the confusion spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the madcap). While under the effects of this confusion, the creature is immune to Foment Madness.

trait.name: Reckless Pugilism
trait.text: At the start of its turn the madcap can gain advantage on all unarmed strikes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the madcap disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The madcap makes two melee attacks.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

trait.name: Shadow Blend
trait.text: The spore farmer can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the destination space must be in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

monster.name: Fungah, The Undervoid

trait.name: Fungi Presence
trait.text: When any creature that isn't infected by the dark spores starts its turn within a mile of the Undervoid, that creature must succeed on on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage from the dark spores.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the Undervoid fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Undervoid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the Undervoid has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Undervoid makes ten attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 47 (6d12 + 8) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendrils
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) piercing damage and the target is Grappled (escape DC 21). Until the grapple ends, the Undervoid can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
action.text: The undervoid pulls each creature grappled by it up to 10 feet towards it.

action.name: Summon Infected Minions (3/Day)
action.text: Up to eight infected dwarves or orcs appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the Undervoid and remain until destroyed. Infected creatures summoned in this way roll initiative and act in the next available turn.

action.name: Spores Attack (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Undervoid can send out a burst of dark spores in a 120-foot radius. Any creatures in that area must make a DC 20 Constituion saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The Undervoid makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The Undervoid attacks with a tendril.

legendary.name: Swat Away
legendary.text: The Undervoid makes a tendril attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed back 15 feet from the Undervoid. If the saving throw fails by 4 or more, the target also falls prone.

monster.description:
Evil has spread into the multiverse and takes form in many ways. The Undervoid is part of this evil, a toxic pool of energy deep in the Underworld. It is a massive being with huge tentacles rising out of the central pool.
Brilliant Mind. This aberration and its dark spores are highly intelligent. They seek to spread out and conquer the underground and surface worlds. Other pools of dark energy are also active throughout the multiverse.
Sowing Discontent. Evil spores are constantly being sent out by this strange aberration. Clouds of spores and many infected minions can be traced back to the Undervoid.
Prophetic End. Some seers have had visions of heroes traveling to the faraway home of this aberration and discovering its source in order to destroy it.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 103 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Gangler
