trait.text: The gangler has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the gangler has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gangler makes two attacks with its arms, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (5d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Arms
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the gangler can't use the same arm to grapple another target.

action.name: Reel
action.text: The gangler can reach up to 20 ft. up or down and pull grappled targets towards it.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 54 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Giant Gargoyle
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gargoyle makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch (2/Day).
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 7 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 55 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Cave Giant

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two attacks with its fists or one with its bite.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the giant can only grapple one other target.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The giant makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the giant, and it takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of the giant's turns. If the giant takes 30 or more damage on a single turn from a creature inside it, the giant must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 5 feet of the giant. If the giant dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 56 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Gloom Giant

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The giant can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: prestidigitation • 1/Day: bane, darkness, dissonant whispers, sleep

trait.name: Shadow of Gloom
trait.text: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant, it is engulfed in shadow. That creature must make a DC 15 saving throw or take 4 (1d8) psychic damage. If the save is successful, the creature is immune to this feature for 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the giant has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spiked Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Groan of Gloom (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The giant groans and any creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 16 (3d10) psychic damage, drop whatever they are holding, and become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of the giant's turn, ending the effect on a success.

monster.spells: prestidigitation, bane, darkness, dissonant whispers, sleep
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 58 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Lava Giant
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the giant or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Lava
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 59 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Thunder Giant

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Crystal Hammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) thunder damage.

action.name: Thunder Shout (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The giant lets out a thunderous shout and any creature within 90 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 45 (10d8) thunder damage and be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 60 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Giant Queen

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The giant has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Giant Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (8d6 + 8) slashing damage.

action.name: Rebel Yell (Recharge 6)
action.text: The giant yells and any creature within 90 feet of it make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 61 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Gloom Shroom

trait.name: Shade of Gloom
trait.text: The gloom shroom casts a dark shadow in a 20-foot radius on the ground around it. Any creature in this area must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or make all saving throws at disadvantage for 1 minute.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shroom disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gloom shroom makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Wave of Weariness (Recharges 2-3)
action.text: The gloom shroom emits spores of weariness in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage and suffers 1 level of exhaustion.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 62 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin), Elder

trait.name: Gem Wisdom
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks when examining gemstones.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components
• At will: nondetection (self only) • 1/Day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gnome makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Summon Earth Elemental (1/Day)
action.text: The gnome can summon an earth elemental, appearing in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of it. The elemental obeys the commands of the gnome.

monster.spells: nondetection, blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self
monster.description:
The deep gnome elders are the part of the svirfneblin leadership. Even the king seeks their advice at times. These wise svirfneblin are usually found clad in black and gray robes, clutching their handy quarterstaff.
Earth Knowledge. These elders have deep relationships with elementals from the Elemental Plane of Earth. They can even summon an elemental to assist them.
Quality Control. More than any other svirfneblin, the elders have an eye for quality gemstones. Younger deep gnomes always have elders examine their gemstones to determine their quality.
Caterpillar Mounts. Some deep gnome elders ride around on giant caterpillars or armored caterpillars.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 63 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin), King

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components
• At will: nondetection (self only) • 2/Day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self, stone shape • 1/Day each: meld into stone, move earth, wall of stone

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gnome makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Great War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: nondetection, blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self, stone shape, meld into stone, move earth, wall of stone
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 64 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin), Ranger

trait.name: Cunning Action (3/Day)
trait.text: The gnome can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components
• At will: nondetection (self only) • 1/Day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self, hunter's mark, pass without trace

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gnome makes two attacks.

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. Hit: 1 + 4 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: nondetection, blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self, hunter's mark, pass without trace
monster.description:
Svirfneblin rangers patrol the borders of their territory. They are the first defense if one of their hidden enclaves is attacked. In some cases, these hardy gnomes are sent on missions deep into enemy territory. Svirfneblin rangers are some of the only deep gnomes who aren't afraid of the dark elves. They will courageously engage any drow they come into contact with.
Blending In. More than any other deep gnome, these warriors are able to blend into the surroundings. Drow have reported that the svirfneblin seem to appear out of thin air.
Crossbow Experts. Unlike other deep gnomes, the rangers are armed with light crossbows. The bolts are tipped with a strong poison. These gnomes learned how to poison their bolts after numerous encounters with the drow.
Old Gnomes Club. All svirfneblin rangers are male. However, a few female warriors have petitioned the king to have this tradition changed. Due to the patriarchal structure of their society, this petition has little chance to persuade the monarch.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 65 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Goblin Queen

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The goblin queen can use a bonus action to take the Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The goblin queen's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit). The goblin queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: fire bolt, poison spray, thaumaturgy • 2/Day: burning hands, thunderwave, witch bolt • 1/Day: crown of madness, mage armor, scorching ray

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The goblin queen makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Summon Swarm of Rats (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: The goblin queen can summon a swarm of rats. It will appear in an unoccupied space in 1d4 rounds and obeys the goblin queen.

monster.spells: fire bolt, poison spray, thaumaturgy, burning hands, thunderwave, witch bolt, crown of madness, mage armor, scorching ray
monster.description: Source: Monsters of The Underworld p. 66 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Gold Mold
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Dissolve Metal
trait.text: Any weapon made of metal that hits the ooze dissolves in 1 minute. The ooze can eat through 6-inch thick metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing metal armor, its armor dissolves in one minute.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 67 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Spider Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spider golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Kick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Iron Web (Recharge 6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 530/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by extremely strong wire webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 19 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can alsobe attackedand destroyed (AC 16; hp 40; resistant to cold, fire, lightning damage; immune to poison and psychic damage).

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 68 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Grim Druid

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the grim druid can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the grim druid has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The grim druid is a 9th level druid, its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit). It has the following spells prepared.
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, poison spray, thorn whip • 1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, entangle, fog cloud, speak with animals • 2nd level (3 slots): barkskin, heat metal, pass without trace • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, feign death, meld into stone • 4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion, hallucinatory terrain • 5th level (2 slots): conjure elemental

action.name: Darkstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The druid halves the damage that it takes from one attack that hits it. The druid must be able to see the attacker to use this ability.

monster.spells: druidcraft, poison spray, thorn whip, animal friendship, entangle, fog cloud, speak with animals, barkskin, heat metal, pass without trace, dispel magic, feign death, meld into stone, blight, confusion, hallucinatory terrain, conjure elemental
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 69 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Hag Queen
monster.languages: Abyssal, Common, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, Undercommon
monster.resist: cold, fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Hag Crown
trait.text: If the hag queen is wearing her crown, she can see invisible creatures and the true form of any shapechanger.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The hag queen's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit). The hag queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: dancing lights, detect evil and good, hellish rebuke, minor illusion, vicious mockery (11th level) • 3/Day: charm person, darkness, dispel magic, ray of enfeeblement, sleep, witch bolt • 1/Day: blight, fear, gaseous form, stinking cloud, suggestion

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the hag queen fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hag queen makes two attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The hag queen magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The hag queen reverts to her true form if she dies.

action.name: Dark Glare
action.text: The hag queen targets one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of the hag's next turn. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the hag queen's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
legendary.text: The hag queen makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Misty Step (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The hag queen casts misty step.

legendary.name: Spit Poison
legendary.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

monster.spells: dancing lights, detect evil and good, hellish rebuke, minor illusion, vicious mockery, charm person, darkness, dispel magic, ray of enfeeblement, sleep, witch bolt, blight, fear, gaseous form, stinking cloud, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 70 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Illuminai

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The illuminai has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The illuminai's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The illuminai can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components
• At will: detect evil and good • 2/Day each: cure wounds, dispel evil and good, light, pass without trace

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The illuminai makes two attacks.

action.name: Sword of Light
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage and 13 (3d8) radiant damage. Once a day can also be used to cast misty step.

action.name: Bow of Light
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The illuminai adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the illuminai must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, cure wounds, dispel evil and good, light, pass without trace
monster.description:
Legends tell of a brave knighthood that makes forays into the Underworld to vanquish evil. These disciplined warriors are known as the Illuminai. Their holy light shines even in the darkest corners of this dangerous land.
Divine Vision. Since they spend so much time in the dark, these knights have been granted a divine boon of darkvision. Their deities are aware these brave souls must be able to find their way around the subterranean land.
Holy Horses. These knights often ride winged celestials known as night steeds (page 83). They are distant cousins of the pegasi and are able to see in the dark.
Shining Swords. Illuminai are armed with two unique weapons to deal with their evil opponents. Both their sword of light and bow of light are divine instruments.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 71 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Lich King
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the lich king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich king gains a new body in 1d6 days, regaining all its Hit Points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 60 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The lich king has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The lich is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its Spellcasting Ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 22, +14 to hit with spell attacks). The lich king has the following spells prepared
• Cantrips (at will): Chill Touch, Firebolt, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Ray of Frost • 1st level (4 slots): Detect Magic, Feather Fall, Magic Missile, Shield, Thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): Darkness, Detect Thoughts, Invisibility, Acid Arrow, Mirror Image • 3rd level (3 slots): Animate Dead, Counterspell, Dispel Magic, Fireball, Water Walk • 4th level (3 slots): Banishment, Blight, Dimension Door • 5th level (3 slots): Mislead, Modify Memory, Scrying • 6th level (1 slot): Create Undead, Disintegrate, Globe of Invulnerability • 7th level (1 slot): Finger of Death, Plane Shift • 8th level (1 slot): Dominate Monster, Power Word Stun • 9th level (1 slot): Power Word Kill

action.name: Staff of the Dark Mage
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (3d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. The staff can also be used to cast counterspell as a reaction

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: The lich king casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Staff Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lich king attacks with its staff.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be Paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Effect on itself on a success. If the save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

monster.spells: Chill Touch, Firebolt, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Ray of Frost, Detect Magic, Feather Fall, Magic Missile, Shield, Thunderwave, Darkness, Detect Thoughts, Invisibility, Acid Arrow, Mirror Image, Animate Dead, Counterspell, Dispel Magic, Fireball, Water Walk, Banishment, Blight, Dimension Door, Mislead, Modify Memory, Scrying, Create Undead, Disintegrate, Globe of Invulnerability, Finger of Death, Plane Shift, Dominate Monster, Power Word Stun, Power Word Kill
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 72 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Lycanthrope, Werewolf Lord
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Armor Class
trait.text: 13 in humanoid form, 15 (natural armor) in wolf or hybrid form

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The werewolf lord has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werewolf lord can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: The werewolf lord makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or greatsword.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage

action.name: Howl
action.text: Any creature within 90 feet of the werewolf lord and hears it howl must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is unsuccessful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the werewolf lord's Howl for the next 24 hours.

monster.description:
While there aren't many lycanthropes in this strange land, there is a mighty werewolf lord. The werewolf lord lives in a hidden underground lair far from the eyes of surface-dwellers. He uses this stronghold to launch attacks and plot against the world above. Many years ago, this lycanthrope was actually a wealthy noble. However, he was bitten by a werewolf and fled underground.
Lunatic Lord. A special tower gives this monster a view of the moon on clear nights. At times, this has allowed access to unwanted visitors. Some creatures have found their way into the underground realm through this tower. However, those that encounter this lycanthrope are never seen again.
Subterranean Sounds. The eerie howl of the werewolf lord might be the last sound someone hears. It sends victims running for their lives. As creatures attempt to flee, this lycanthrope is known to hunt them down for sport.
We are Family. Some lycanthropes come to live in the werewolf lord's lair. Werewolves are the most common resident, but there are other lycanthropes as well. It is made very clear to any newcomers that the werewolf lord is in charge.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 73 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Magmamental
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Magma Form
trait.text: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 3 inches wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 5 cold damage. If it loses half of its hit points, it also loses half of its movement speed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) fire damage and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become restrained as the magma cools. The target can break out of the cooled magma by making a DC 13 Strength saving throw.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 75 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Minotaur King

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 (3d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the minotaur fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The minotaur makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Double-Bladed Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d12 + 6) slashing damage. If the target has at least one head and the attack roll is a '20', the axe cuts off one of the target's heads. Targets are immune to this effect if they are immune to slashing damage, don't have or need a head, have legendary actions, or the DM decides the target's head is too big.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Magical Maze (1/Day).
action.text: The minotaur creates a massive magical maze. Any creature's in a 1-mile radius must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be sent to the center of the maze. On a success the target finds itself at one of the many entrances on the edge of the maze. The minotaur is also sent into the maze and begins to hunt down the targets.

legendary.name: Gore
legendary.text: The minotaur makes a gore attack.

legendary.name: Heal Self (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

legendary.name: Summon Minotaurs (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Summons 1d4 minotaurs which appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the minotaur in 1d6 rounds.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 76 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Minotaur Lord

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 (3d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The minotaur makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

monster.name: Minotaur Mage

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The minotaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Robes of the Maze
trait.text: These robes enable the minotaur mage to cast misty step three times a day.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The minotaur is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared
• Cantrips (at will): acid splash, blade ward, dancing lights, prestidigitation • 1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, fog cloud, shield, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, scorching ray, see invisibility • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, fear, lightning bolt • 4th level (1 slots): confusion

action.name: Crystal Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: acid splash, blade ward, dancing lights, prestidigitation, chromatic orb, fog cloud, shield, thunderwave, detect thoughts, scorching ray, see invisibility, dispel magic, fear, lightning bolt, confusion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 78 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Monster Hunter

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The monster hunter's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The mosnter hunter can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, detect magic • 3/Day: cure wounds, hunter's mark, pass without trace • 1/Day: lesser restoration, locate creature, longstrider, nondetection, spider climb

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The monster hunter has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The monster hunter makes two melee attacks or one ranged.

action.name: Darkbane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage. Can cast light with a bonus action.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The monster hunter halves the damage that it takes from one attack that hits it. The monster hunter must be able to see the attacker to use this ability.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, detect magic, cure wounds, hunter's mark, pass without trace, lesser restoration, locate creature, longstrider, nondetection, spider climb
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 79 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Maga Naga
monster.languages: Understands and speaks Common, Abyssal, and Undercommon but can barely read them

trait.name: Compulsive Liar
trait.text: The naga feels compelled to lie the majority of the time.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d20 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The naga is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared
• Cantrips (at will): thaumaturgy, vicious mockery • 1st level (4 slots): charm person, command, dissonant whispers, illusory script • 2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, entrhall, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, fear, stinking cloud • 4th level (3 slots): banishment, compulsion, confusion • 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, geas, mislead • 6th level (1 slots): mass suggestion

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the naga has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Incite Violence (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: The naga can choose to incite violence in a 120-foot radius. All creatures in that area must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. An unsuccessdul saving throw results in the target attacking the nearest creature for the next minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

monster.spells: thaumaturgy, vicious mockery, charm person, command, dissonant whispers, illusory script, crown of madness, entrhall, suggestion, bestow curse, fear, stinking cloud, banishment, compulsion, confusion, flame strike, geas, mislead, mass suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 80 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Necromancer, The

trait.name: Aura of Fear
trait.text: Any creature within 60 feet of the necromancer must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the necromancer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The necromancer is an 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared
• Cantrips (at will): blade ward, chill touch, message, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp • 1st level (4 slots): false life, fog cloud, ray of sickness, silent image • 2nd level (4 slots): detect thoughts, misty step, ray of enfeeblement, scorching ray • 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, bestow curse, vampiric touch • 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door, wall of fire • 5th level (3 slots): animate objects, dominate person, geas • 6th level (1 slots): circle of death • 6th level (1 slots): finger of death

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The necromaner has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The necromancer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Black Rod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) bludgeoning damage and sends out a black necrotic storm in a 60-ft cone. Creatures take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. Or an action can also be used to dispel magic.

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: The necromancer casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Summons Wolves (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The necromancer summons 1d6 dire wolves which arrive in 1d6 rounds.

legendary.name: Summons Wraiths (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: 30% chance to summon a wraith which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of it.

monster.spells: blade ward, chill touch, message, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, false life, fog cloud, ray of sickness, silent image, detect thoughts, misty step, ray of enfeeblement, scorching ray, animate dead, bestow curse, vampiric touch, blight, dimension door, wall of fire, animate objects, dominate person, geas, circle of death, finger of death
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 81 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Nightmare Bear

trait.name: Living Nightmare
trait.text: Creatures within 20 ft. of the nightmare bear that aren't undead must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or begin to have horrible visions. The target is incapacitated; however, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. Once a target saves against this feature, they are immune to it for 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the nightmare bear has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nightmare bear makes two attacks: one with its and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 82 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Night Steed

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the night steed has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 83 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Flying Ogre

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The ogre has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +ý to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning.

action.name: Block the Path
action.text: Until the start of the ogre's next turn, attack rolls against the ogre have disadvantage, it has advantage on the attack roll it makes for an opportunity attack, and that attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage on a hit. Also, each enemy that tries to move out of the ogre's reach without teleporting must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 84 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Orc, Bat Rider

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see. It can't use this ability while mounted.

trait.name: Born to Fly
trait.text: The orc has advantage on saving throws to avoid falling off its giant bat mount.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The orc doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies on its mount out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The orc makes two attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage.

action.name: Bat Outta Hell Yell (1/Day)
action.text: While riding a giant bat, the orc can call out a cry in unison with the mount. this rallying cry gives both rider and mount +2 to their attack rolls and saving throws until the end of their next turn.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 85 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Orc, Chieftan

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the orc moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a longsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The orc makes two attacks with its sword or bow, or one attack with its shield.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the creature is Large or smaller,it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 86 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Orc, King

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Hardened Hide
trait.text: The orc's tough skin is as thick as plate armor.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
trait.text: While it has less than half its hit points, the orc has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The orc makes two attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Rally the Horde (2/Day)
action.text: The orc has the ability to rally his horde of orcs. Twice a day the king can call out to those orcs within 120 feet of him. These minionsgain +2 to their attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 88 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Orc, Scout

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: The orc can use a bonus action on its turn to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

trait.name: Favored Underworld Enemy
trait.text: The orc has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track dwarves and elves.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The orc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The orc makes two attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 89 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Orc, Shaman

trait.name: Brew Potions
trait.text: Given one day and the right ingredients, the orc can brew the following potions: potion of climbing, potion of healing, or a potion of poison.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The orc's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 with spell attacks). The orc can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, poison spray • 2/Day: detect magic, entangle • 1/Day: flame blade, hold person, silence

action.name: Flail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, poison spray, detect magic, entangle, flame blade, hold person, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 90 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Giant Roper

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the giant roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalactite.

trait.name: Grasping Tendrils
trait.text: The roper can have up to eight tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 15 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 17 Strength check against it.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The giant roper has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The roper makes eight attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one Attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is Grappled (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target is Restrained and has disadvantage on Strength Checks and Strength Saving Throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
action.text: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet towards it.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 92 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Rumbledum
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the rumbledum remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal boulder.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: As long as the rumbledum is in contact with the earth and has at least 1 hit point, it regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Rolling Charge
trait.text: If the rumbledum moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The rumbledum can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) thunder damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 93 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Shade Stalker

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shade stalker can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shade stalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Hook
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. If unsuccessful, the target loses one point of Strength and must complete a Short or Long rest to heal this effect.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 94 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Shadow Knight

trait.name: Shadow Jump
trait.text: As a bonus action, the shadow knight can teleport up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the destination space must be in dim light or darkness. The shadow knight can use this ability between the weapon attacks of another action it takes.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shadow knight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadow knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Darksword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Grave Bolts
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Summon Shadows (1/Day)
action.text: Two shadows appear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the shadow knight and remain until destroyed. Shadows summoned in this way roll initiative and act in the next available turn.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The shadow knight adds 1 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, the shadow knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 95 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Shadow Lord

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The shadow lord's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The shadow lord can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: prestidigitation • 1/Day: blur, darkness, mirror image

trait.name: Shadow Jump
trait.text: As a bonus action, the shadow knight can teleport up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the destination space must be in dim light or darkness. The shadow knight can use this ability between the weapon attacks of another action it takes.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shadow knight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Darksword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

action.text: Up to six shadows appear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the shadow knight and remain until destroyed. Shadows summoned in this way roll initiative and act in the next available turn.

monster.name: Shadow Spider
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Skill
trait.text: Stealth +8 In Dim Light Or Darkness

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The spider can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the spider can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the spider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. Each turn the target remains in the web, their Strength is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if their Strength is reduced to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12, hp 15; immunity to acid, cold, fire, bludgeoning, lightning, thunder, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 97 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Toadstool Fool

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The toadstool fool's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The fool can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: dancing lights, vicious mockery • 1/Day: darkness, faerie fire, fog cloud, suggestion

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the fool has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Fool's Tool
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

action.name: Throws Shade (1/Day)
action.text: The toadstool fool can create a 10-foot sphere of magical darkness within 30 feet of it. Any creature in the darkness must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The sphere doesn't affect the toadstool fool.

monster.name: Underworld Dryad

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
• At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, poison spray • 3/Day: dispel evil and good, entangle, silence • 1/Day: barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mushroom Stride
trait.text: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movementto step magically into one living mushroom within her reach and emerge from a second living mushroom within 60 feet of the first mushroom appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom. Both mushroom must be Large or bigger.

trait.name: Speak With Beasts and Plants
trait.text: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, druidcraft, poison spray, dispel evil and good, entangle, silence, barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh
monster.description:
A cold, high voice laughs in the darkness. Small creatures flee the area and brush past your legs. Something sinister is out there. Emerging from the dark is a feminine form. This beautiful fey is an underworld dryad.
Friend of the Fungi. The underworld dryad is formed when a lost spirit is bound to a large mushroom by a powerful evil fey. If the mushroom is ever destroyed the spirit is free to pass on its journey to the next realm.
Gorgeous Guardians. Underworld dryads work with evil fey to protect fungi forests. Legends tell of these fey making use of their extraordinary beauty.
Mushroom Home. The mushroom home of the underworld dryad can be destroyed (AC 15, 35 hit points, immune to poison). If it is, the fey's form is destroyed and the mushroom disappears. However, these homes are well hidden deep inside fungi forests.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 105 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Web Walker

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the web walker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The web walker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the web walker knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The web walker ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The web walker makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12, hp 15; immunity to fire, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

reaction.name: Web Shield
reaction.text: The web walker spins a web shield and adds 1 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the web walker must see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 107 (Homebrew)

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zombie makes two attacks; one slam attack and one headbutt attack.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Headbutt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Zombie King

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The zombie king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The zombie king is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components. Cantrip (at will): blade ward, chill touch, dancing lights, poison spray, vicious mockery • 1st level (4 slots): bane, detect evil and good, inflict wounds, sleep • 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, knock, locate object • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, slow, speak with dead • 4th level (3 slots): blight, hallucinatory terrain • 5th level (2 slots): animate objects, passwall

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The zombie king has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Death Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (6d6 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the king's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The zombie king can have no more than 20 zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Summon Zombies (3/Day)
action.text: Up to eight zombies appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the zombie king and remain until destroyed. Zombies summoned in this way roll initiative and act in the next available turn. The zombie king can have up to eight zombies summoned by this ability at a time.

monster.spells: blade ward, chill touch, dancing lights, poison spray, vicious mockery, bane, detect evil and good, inflict wounds, sleep, darkness, knock, locate object, dispel magic, slow, speak with dead, blight, hallucinatory terrain, animate objects, passwall
